What is the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, and what features does it offer?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace is a decentralized platform where users can buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs on-chain. It allows users to advertise their offers directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or post the sale of their NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see. The platform enables transactions to be executed in a completely decentralized way, without the need for intermediaries. Users can pay or offer to pay from transparent or zero-knowledge private addresses, and accept payment to either, while still maintaining the ability to audit transactions.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.A locked VerusID can always be revoked and recovered by its revocation and recovery authority identities, which circumvents the lock. At the same time, anyone with only the primary keys, even a multisig of primary keys must first unlock, then wait for the predetermined unlock time before they can spend or access funds. This gives you, or maybe a company that specializes in watching the blockchain to whom you've assigned the revocation ID to revoke and recover whenever an unauthorized unlock occurs. That means that like a bank, setting a 24 hour unlock delay on your locked IDs actually provides the first decentralized solution to the infamous 5 dollar wrench attack.In addition to a new level of blockchain protection and decentralized funds recovery, Verus Vault provides the same security for your IDs and NFTs as well as time locks for other purposes, such as vesting schedules, trusts, and inheritance. With Verus Vault, you can now protect and recover your funds, preserving all your assets and generational blockchain wealth from common forms of crypto loss or theft, no bank required.
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What is Verus Vault, and what benefits does it offer?

Verus Vault is a feature that allows users to protect funds on a VerusID, even in the event of private key theft. When a VerusID is locked with Vault, the funds cannot be spent until it is unlocked. While locked, the funds can still be staked on the Verus network to earn rewards. Additionally, users can still receive funds. Verus Vault also provides a decentralized solution to the "5-dollar wrench attack" by allowing users to set an unlock delay, which can be revoked and recovered by a designated revocation and recovery authority identity.

To enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities, users must have at least one primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured.

How does Verus Vault prevent unauthorized access to my locked funds?

If someone tries to unlock your locked VerusID without authorization, the revocation and recovery authority identities can detect the unauthorized unlock and revoke and recover the funds. This provides a decentralized solution to the "5 dollar wrench attack" (where an attacker forces you to reveal your private keys). By setting a predetermined unlock time, such as a 24-hour delay, you can ensure that even if an unauthorized unlock occurs, the revocation and recovery authority identities can intervene and prevent the theft of your funds.

How does Verus Vault prevent unauthorized access to funds, and what is the "5 dollar wrench attack"?

Verus Vault prevents unauthorized access to funds by requiring a predetermined unlock time before the funds can be spent or accessed. This means that even if someone gains access to the primary keys, they must first unlock the VerusID and then wait for the unlock time to pass before they can access the funds. This feature provides protection against the "5 dollar wrench attack", which is a type of attack where an attacker gains physical access to a user's device or keys, forcing them to reveal their private keys.

How does Verus Vault prevent unauthorized access to funds, and what is the "5 dollar wrench attack"?

Verus Vault prevents unauthorized access to funds by allowing users to set a delay between unlocking their VerusID and being able to spend funds. This delay can be set to a predetermined time, such as 24 hours. During this time, the revocation and recovery authority identities can detect any unauthorized unlock attempts and revoke the unlock. This provides protection against the "5 dollar wrench attack", where an attacker uses physical force or coercion to gain access to a user's private keys.

What are some of the additional use cases for Verus Vault beyond just protecting funds from theft?

Verus Vault provides additional security for IDs and NFTs, as well as time locks for other purposes, such as vesting schedules, trusts, and inheritance. This allows users to set up complex arrangements for the management and transfer of their assets, while maintaining the security and decentralization of the Verus network.
